page.title: 01Fertile Land Near Tollerton
page.content: This area is flat agricultural land, part of the fertile Vale of York. The farming is mainly cereal and vegetables with a small amount of livestock. The east coast main railway line crosses this section as does the A19 trunk road from York to the NE. On the eastern edge of the section there are small woods and coppices, all that remains of the ancient Forest of Galtres. The land is well drained by ditches passing the streams into the River Kyle and then to the River Ouse. A new pipeline distributing natural gas has recently been laid alongside the A19 road. There are farms and small-holdings scattered across this section.
